[   Description     Are you looking to jumpstart a rewarding career in banking but arenâ€™t sure how to get started?          Discover an exciting opportunity to take your career to the next level as part of our Associate Licensed Relationship Banker program. This is a unique opportunity for customer focused professionals looking to secure the licenses needed for our Licensed Relationship Banker career. As part of this program, you will develop your skills and obtain licensing to help customers save, spend, borrow and plan for retirement.           As an Associate Licensed Relationship Banker, you will be developing in the role of a banker while studying for the required licenses. Once licensed    by passing your Securities Industry Essentials Exam, Series 6, 63, and Life and Health License Exams, you will move to the Licensed Relationship Banker role and have dual responsibilities in both banking and investments.              A Day in the Life of an Associate Licensed Relationship Banker       Work closely with new and existing customers to understand their financial needs and deepen relationships    Provide recommendations and assist customers with a wide-array of financial solutions to help them save, spend, borrow and plan for retirement    Leverage problem-solving and strong communication skills to resolve customer issues    Collaborate with branch colleagues and partners to support and refer customers with more complex financial needs     Ensure compliance  with all financial policies, procedures and regulatory requirements    Achieve outstanding performance  by going above and beyond for customers each day    Be the face of Citizens Bank, presenting a professional, friendly and helpful appearance with every interaction.    Take part in our Paid Study Program to pass your Securities Industry Essentials Exam, Series 6, 63, and Life and Health License Exams needed to advance to the Licensed Relationship Banker role       What can we offer you?        Ongoing support and guidance such as on-the-job learning, hands-on experience and mentorship    Paid study time, study materials and a testing window to secure your Securities Industry Essentials Exam, Series 6, 63, and Life and Health License Exams as part of the program    Strong recognition and incentive plans to accelerate you earning potential based on your achievements    Opportunities to develop your career and grow into new roles, such as a Licensed Relationship Banker, Premier Advisor, Branch Manager or Financial Advisor     Training, strategies and tools to support your personal growth and the development of strong customer relationships    Collaborative workforce committed to supporting your ideas and feedback and accelerating your potential    Team atmosphere of diverse professionals committed to making an impact as an organization    Opportunities to volunteer and give back to our local communities    Exceptional benefits such as Medical & Dental, along with a 401K with corporate match        Qualifications     What qualifications are we looking for?      College degree in business related field or in lieu of education a High School degree or GED with 2 years of customer service experience.  You are required to obtain all required licenses as part of our Paid Study Program. Licenses must be obtained in the following order: Securities Industry Essentials Exam; Series 6 license; Series 63 license; Life/Health Insurance licenses  Ability to effectively engage with customers and identify needs to enhance the customer relationship   Exceptional listening and communication skills, ability to present features and benefits of products and services to customers with differing needs  Ability to problem solve and provide solutions to customer issues  A track record of working effectively in a team environment and building solid relationships with teammates, business partners and specialists through collaboration  Self-motivated, confident, and ability to multitask effectively   Willingness to work branch hours, which can include weekends and evenings   If selected, candidates must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks and obtaining a Unique Identifier from the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS). [   Description    Responsibilities        Do you enjoy being the face of an organization, engaging with customers to ensure they are fully satisfied? This is the heart of our Customer Service Teller role - delivering a memorable and personalized banking experience for each customer.        As the primary contact between our customers and the branch team, you will use great listening skills to engage closely with customers while processing customer service transactions accurately and efficiently. With an energetic attitude, you will get to know the customer, anticipate their needs, introduce them to financial products and services and make referrals to supporting branch colleagues as appropriate.        This role is an opportunity to strengthen your consumer banking knowledge with paths to grow into other Retail, Business Banking and Wealth Management roles. High School degree or GED required   2 years of sales and customer service experience   Minimum of 1 year cash handling experience preferred  Strong listening and customer service skills; skilled in making outbound calls  Ability to effectively engage with customers and identify needs to enhance the customer relationship   Ability to problem solve and provide solutions to customer issues  Desire to build strong relationships with teammates, business partners and specialists through collaboration  Self-motivated, confident, and ability to multitask effectively   Willingness to work branch hours, which can include weekends and evenings   Experience in retail, hospitality or banking industry is highly desired  If selected, candidates must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks and obtaining a Unique Identifier from the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS).     Hours and Work Schedule   Hours per Week: 40  Work Schedule: Varies with branch needs and may include Saturdays             Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth.    Equal Employment Opportunity    It is the policy of Citizens Bank to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.   Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran   Citizens Bank is a brand name of Citizens Bank, N.A. and each of its respective subsidiaries.     ]

[ Description

The Treasury Head of Trade position will provide senior leadership, coaching and direction to a prosperous team of Core Product Managers, Product Analyst and Sales for the Trade product segment. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following key areas of focus:

  • Set expectations for detailed in-depth business requirements.
  • Provide alignment with the Treasury Solutions strategy for current and future product sets and drive product growth; monitoring Product Revenue, Penetration/usage.
  • Orchestrate Product Manager involvement with Sales to drive new business opportunities to â€œwin dealsâ€.
  • Act as the Treasury Trade primary liaison within the division and across the bank for the product set.
  • Build critical partnerships with key business lines (Business Services, Technology, Risk, the RM community, Credit etc.) while being the primary subject matter expert (SME) in terms of industry focus/market competition across the products in the group.
  • Responsible for understanding the impact of regulatory changes to the product set and driving the necessary modifications to ensure compliance.
  • Coordinate with credit, trade operations and trade sales to ensure sufficient availability of overseas correspondent bank credit limits to support client needs. Approve and monitor usage of these facilities.
  • Work with Trade Sales, Credit, Trade Operations, and external partners as necessary to assist with Trade deal structure and pricing, particularly for complex or unique requirements.
  • Review and approve structures for all Supply Chain or Trade financing for appropriateness and adherence to internal policies and procedures.
  • Responsible for understanding and adapting to technology trends impacting commercial banking.
  • Ensure all components of client readiness, and colleague readiness (pre-launch activities which require participation from multiple stakeholders â€“ Sales, Implementation, Client Services, Business Services, Marketing, etc.) are managed by Product Manager/Product Analyst. Qualifications
  • Broad and deep experience with treasury and cash management products and services.
  • BA/BS, MA or MBA preferred.
  • Excellent senior-level leadership skills, with proven ability to recruit talent and recognize/motivate colleagues in a changing environment.
  • Deep knowledge and understanding of international banking, overseas correspondent relations and international funds movement and settlement.
  • Robust understanding of and experience in Trade/Supply Chain products including the competitive landscape, industry trends, vendor landscape, etc.
  • Understanding of the operational and service sides of the business, as well as markets and financials.
  • Ability to communicate at all levels within a large organization.
  • Solid understanding of product development life cycle.
  • Proven ability to translate/communicate business needs for the benefit of Sales and our clients.
  • Strong analytical skills/financial acumen.
  • Self-starter and pro-active thinker
  • Understands and supports broad Treasury Solutions business strategies and translates these broad strategies to product strategy
  • Able to build strong and effective relationships within Citizens Bank.
  • Possesses in-depth understanding of competitors and competitive position and uses that information to create competitive advantage Why Work for Us At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth. [   Description     Are you looking to jumpstart a rewarding career in banking but arenâ€™t sure how to get started?          Discover an exciting opportunity to take your career to the next level as part of our Associate Licensed Relationship Banker program. This is a unique opportunity for customer focused professionals looking to secure the licenses needed for our Licensed Relationship Banker career. As part of this program, you will develop your skills and obtain licensing to help customers save, spend, borrow and plan for retirement.           As an Associate Licensed Relationship Banker, you will be developing in the role of a banker while studying for the required licenses. Once licensed    by passing your Securities Industry Essentials Exam, Series 6, 63, and Life and Health License Exams, you will move to the Licensed Relationship Banker role and have dual responsibilities in both banking and investments.              A Day in the Life of an Associate Licensed Relationship Banker       Work closely with new and existing customers to understand their financial needs and deepen relationships    Provide recommendations and assist customers with a wide-array of financial solutions to help them save, spend, borrow and plan for retirement    Leverage problem-solving and strong communication skills to resolve customer issues    Collaborate with branch colleagues and partners to support and refer customers with more complex financial needs     Ensure compliance  with all financial policies, procedures and regulatory requirements    Achieve outstanding performance  by going above and beyond for customers each day    Be the face of Citizens Bank, presenting a professional, friendly and helpful appearance with every interaction.    Take part in our Paid Study Program to pass your Securities Industry Essentials Exam, Series 6, 63, and Life and Health License Exams needed to advance to the Licensed Relationship Banker role       What can we offer you? [ Description

The Treasury Head of Trade position will provide senior leadership, coaching and direction to a prosperous team of Core Product Managers, Product Analyst and Sales for the Trade product segment. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following key areas of focus:

  • Set expectations for detailed in-depth business requirements.
  • Provide alignment with the Treasury Solutions strategy for current and future product sets and drive product growth; monitoring Product Revenue, Penetration/usage.
  • Orchestrate Product Manager involvement with Sales to drive new business opportunities to â€œwin dealsâ€.
  • Act as the Treasury Trade primary liaison within the division and across the bank for the product set.
  • Build critical partnerships with key business lines (Business Services, Technology, Risk, the RM community, Credit etc.) while being the primary subject matter expert (SME) in terms of industry focus/market competition across the products in the group.
  • Responsible for understanding the impact of regulatory changes to the product set and driving the necessary modifications to ensure compliance.
  • Coordinate with credit, trade operations and trade sales to ensure sufficient availability of overseas correspondent bank credit limits to support client needs. Approve and monitor usage of these facilities.
  • Work with Trade Sales, Credit, Trade Operations, and external partners as necessary to assist with Trade deal structure and pricing, particularly for complex or unique requirements.
  • Review and approve structures for all Supply Chain or Trade financing for appropriateness and adherence to internal policies and procedures.
  • Responsible for understanding and adapting to technology trends impacting commercial banking.
  • Ensure all components of client readiness, and colleague readiness (pre-launch activities which require participation from multiple stakeholders â€“ Sales, Implementation, Client Services, Business Services, Marketing, etc.) are managed by Product Manager/Product Analyst. Qualifications
  • Broad and deep experience with treasury and cash management products and services.
  • BA/BS, MA or MBA preferred.
  • Excellent senior-level leadership skills, with proven ability to recruit talent and recognize/motivate colleagues in a changing environment.
  • Deep knowledge and understanding of international banking, overseas correspondent relations and international funds movement and settlement.
  • Robust understanding of and experience in Trade/Supply Chain products including the competitive landscape, industry trends, vendor landscape, etc.
  • Understanding of the operational and service sides of the business, as well as markets and financials.
  • Ability to communicate at all levels within a large organization.
  • Solid understanding of product development life cycle.
  • Proven ability to translate/communicate business needs for the benefit of Sales and our clients.
  • Strong analytical skills/financial acumen.
  • Self-starter and pro-active thinker
  • Understands and supports broad Treasury Solutions business strategies and translates these broad strategies to product strategy
  • Able to build strong and effective relationships within Citizens Bank.
  • Possesses in-depth understanding of competitors and competitive position and uses that information to create competitive advantage Why Work for Us At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth. [    Description    Responsibilities         As an employee of Citizens Financial Group, you become a part of an organization committed to serving customers, colleagues and communities in which we do business. Citizens Financial Group is an established and successful financial services company with a branch presence in 12 states and the ability to conduct business globally.  We are committed to offering comprehensive and competitive benefits, encouraging our colleagues to develop and grow their careers, and providing a fiscally sound and stable work environment while delivering to our customers.  Citizens Financial Group is honored to be a top Lender in the Mortgage sector and is focused on growing our market share in the states we currently operate. We are currently hiring a talented Producing Sales Manager who proactively identifies, develops and maintains a quality network of business relationships that serves as a source of referrals for new mortgage lending opportunities. External relationships are the cornerstone of generating new business and may consist of realtors, builders, professional and personal contacts.    You will be responsible for interviewing new and existing customers to determine their loan needs and advising those customers of appropriate products, terms, and pricing, while gathering any additional required information. Manage sales team to ensure development of relationships with Real Estate Brokers, Developers, CPA's and other referral sources to obtain mortgage leads.   Recruit, develop and manage quality sales team that generates quality loans compliant with company policies and procedures.   Maintain a broad understanding of products, guidelines and pricing strategies     Qualifications     4+ years of residential mortgage sales experience.  Minimum 5 years mortgage management experience.  Proven record of recruiting success.  $10MM in annual closed loan volume.  Bachelor's Degree preferred.  Excellent sales presentation and marketing skills.  Excellent written, organizational and communication skills required.  Working knowledge of FNMA-DU/FHLMC/LP.  Referral network required.  Successful candidate must meet and comply with all requirements for Mortgage Loan Originators set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks and obtaining a Unique Identifier from the NMLRS. [   Description     Are you looking to jumpstart a rewarding career in banking but arenâ€™t sure how to get started? High School degree or GED required   Minimum of 1 year cash handling experience strongly preferred   2 years of sales and customer service experience   Strong listening and customer service skills  Ability to effectively ask questions and identify needs to enhance the customer relationship   Commitment to building relationships through phone engagements  Ability to problem solve and provide solutions to customer issues  Ability to strengthen relationships with teammates, business partners and specialists through collaboration  Self-motivated, confident, and ability to multitask effectively   Ability to work InStore branch hours, which include weekends and evenings  If selected, candidates must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks and obtaining a Unique Identifier from the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS).     Hours and Work Schedule    Hours per Week: 40  Work Schedule: Varies based on branch schedule and needs, Monday through Sunday        Be a great Citizen.     Join us today.        Join us as an InStore Universal Banker and use your outstanding people skills to help shape our customer banking experience and drive your career potential at Citizens Bank.               Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth. [    Description    As a Branch Manager, youâ€™ll operate as business leaders and be responsible for coaching and building your team in a profit and loss environment. You determine the success of your branch by recruiting top talent with the ability to forecast staffing needs. Manage a High Performing Team:  Show accountability by taking ownership of the business and willingness to make customer-focused decisions when needed. [    Description    The Lead Documentation Specialist will work with other Documentation Specialists in the Chicago office of Citizens Asset Finance, Inc. (â€œCAFâ€), the equipment leasing subsidiary of Citizens Bank, N.A.         The Lead Documentation Specialist will be responsible for working with the team and processing transactions in the role of a Senior Documentation Specialist described below. [    Description   The Enterprise Architect is an experienced professional providing technology architecture expertise and guidance across multiple business divisions, organizations & technology domains. This role will incorporate a strong consultant oriented approach working across business and technology teams to summarize the current environment and establish a target vision aligned with business and IT strategy. Through engagement with business partners and a deep understanding of technology capabilities, industry trends and business areas you're responsible for, you will lead efforts to align strategic investment planning & major programs for one or more business areas.   The Enterprise Architect will be responsible for:    Translate business strategy into a strategic investment portfolio    Define / maintain Target Architectures in Roadmaps.    Influencing the technology strategy & technology investments that will realize the business strategy.    Influence vendors & partners.    Lead and/or assist efforts to scope and architect major change programs, leading strategic options analysis & proposing end-to-end solutions & highlighting trade-offs.    Review ongoing designs of major programs to identify strategic opportunities and resolve design issues during delivery.    Ensure projects align with strategic capabilities, target architectures & technology standards.      Identify key technology enablers to optimize IT investment.       Qualifications     10+ years relevant technology architecture experience - including evidence of leading efforts to shape strategic investment portfolios and to scope & architect major programs.     Working knowledge of the Financial Services industry in either Consumer / Retail Banking (e.g. digital transformation, consumer lending) & Commercial Banking (e.g. capital markets, transaction banking).    Experience creating & maintaining Architecture Roadmaps.    Hands on experience creating prototypes/MVPs, working closely with the business and fintech partners.     Demonstrated experience of leading virtual teams made up of business and technology resources.    Strong organizational skills with a demonstrated ability to plan and prioritize workload    Strong communication and influencing skills with business & technology executives (Director of Technology, CTO, COO, CIO, Business Division Leads)       Preferred Qualifications:    Demonstrated depth in one or more of the following technology domains: Development tools, ITSM and platform management and monitoring tools, site reliability engineering or availability reference architectures.    Demonstrated experience implementing a CI/CD environment and leading a DevOps team.    Demonstrated experience of identifying and leading forward process improvements.    Experience working with the design, integration and/or support of vendor packages within an overall enterprise architecture.    Working knowledge of Enterprise Architecture frameworks & industry models (TOGAF, ITIL and BIAN).      Education:    Bachelors degree required        Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. [   Description       You might be asking yourself, â€œWhat exactly is an InStore Personal Banker?â€ We partner with top regional grocery store chains throughout our footprint to place bank branches right inside their store. As an InStore Personal Banker, you are at the forefront of delivering an exceptional banking experience to our customers as part of a convenient InStore branch team.      InStore Personal Bankers value strong relationships and find great satisfaction in helping others while offering sound advice. The dynamic and high-traffic environment of the InStore branch provides maximum opportunity for customer-centric, motivated and confident advisors like you to connect with customers and build a pipeline of new business for Citizens Bank. Youâ€™ll make the most of every opportunity to be successful as a self-starter and â€œpeople personâ€.        A Day in the Life of an InStore Personal Banker     Engage with InStore customers to build and deepen relationships by uncovering financial needs and recommending appropriate banking products, services and solutions    Identify new banking customers; grow relationships with existing customers through social interactions within the store along with outbound calls  Open new accounts and assist with teller transactions as needed   Comply with all policies, procedures and regulatory banking requirements   Resolve customer service issues; support banking convenience for customers by sharing and setting up self-service options   Partner with your InStore branch team and specialists to connect customers to experts who can help with specialized financial needs   Adapt, as needed, to meet the ever-changing financial needs of our customers and the communities where we do business   Bring a positive energy and confidence to Citizens Bank and its customers every day  Present a professional appearance as the face of Citizens     What can we offer you?      Strong recognition and incentive programs based on your achievements  Training, strategies and tools to support your personal growth and the development of strong customer relationships  Career growth opportunities in Retail, Business Banking or Wealth Management, including, but not limited to, Small Business Relationship Banker, Licensed Relationship Banker and Branch Manager based on success in this front-line role  Collaborative workforce committed to supporting your ideas and feedback and accelerating your potential  Team atmosphere of diverse professionals committed to making an impact as an organization  Opportunities to volunteer and give back to our local communities  Exceptional benefits such as Medical & Dental, along with a 401K with corporate match       Qualifications        What qualifications are we looking for?      High School degree or GED required   Minimum of 1 year cash handling experience strongly preferred   2 years of sales and customer service experience   Strong listening and customer service skills  Ability to effectively ask questions and identify needs to enhance the customer relationship   Commitment to building relationships through phone engagements  Ability to problem solve and provide solutions to customer issues  Ability to strengthen relationships with teammates, business partners and specialists through collaboration  Self-motivated, confident, and ability to multitask effectively   Ability to work InStore branch hours, which include weekends and evenings  If selected, candidates must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks and obtaining a Unique Identifier from the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS). column2: [    Description    Citizens Securities, Inc. is honored to be a high quality provider in the investment services industry and is focused on growing our market share in the states we currently operate.  We are currently hiring talented Financial Consultants who proactively identify and sell a broad array of Investment and Insurance products to customers.      The successful candidate will work with another Financial Consultant in a partnership/split arrangement and meet with customers to determine their investment needs, recommend investments strategies and present investment choices by analyzing the clientâ€™s information including assets, income, debts and other liabilities, cash flow and tax status.  The Financial Consultant I compares and evaluates possible investment options and identifies investment strategies and potential products based on their knowledge of market conditions and the clientâ€™s circumstances. The Financial Consultant I strives to meet and exceed identified sales goals.  The Financial Consultant I will proactively engage potential new clients to promote and sell investment products and services, while developing strong working relationships with branch personnel in an assigned territory.  We will ask that you also provide coaching and sales support to Branch personnel, while promoting ethical and fully compliant behavior within your given territory. [    Description    Citizens Bank is currently searching for an SBA Business Development Officer to join our Business Banking Team. As a SBA Business Development Officer, you will be responsible for sourcing, identifying, and closing new loan opportunities using the SBA 7(a) and 504 loan programs. Establishing and maintaining a proven network of referral sources from which one can generate a sufficient number of new opportunities to promote the origination of SBA loans in an assigned market will be a primary focus of the position. In addition, you will play a key role in building collaborative relationships with our internal partners across Business Banking, while delivering an exceptional customer experience designed to grow our SBA loan portfolio.     Establishing and sustaining a referral network targeting business brokers, consultants, lawyers, accountants, and related professionals that results in sufficient lead generation to achieve or exceed sales goals.  Developing and implementing a personal business plan and marketing strategy to aid in identifying areas of opportunity for new business penetration, and the creation of a solid contact base of current and potential referral sources.  Working with internal partners to assist in structuring, presenting, and guiding lending opportunities through the application, underwriting, and closing process to ensure that all SBA requirements are met.  Maintaining and applying a thorough understanding of bank credit policy and underwriting guidelines while working with Business Credit Services and operations to practice sound risk management and adherence to applicable regulatory requirements.  Active participation in local SBA district events and functions within assigned geographic markets.         Qualifications     10 years of financial services industry experience.  5 years in commercial lending with expertise in the use and application of the SBA 7(a) and 504 loan programs.  Thorough knowledge and understanding of SBA Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), program eligibility, credit criteria and loan structure Proven track record of sales and outside calling skills.  Local market knowledge and the ability to develop, retain and expand relationships with Centers of Influence.  Professional organization, interpersonal and communication skills - both written and verbal.  Proficient in MS Office applications and familiarity with the Saleforce CRM Platform.      Education, Certifications and/or Other Professional Credentials:      BS Degree or Higher in Business, Finance, Economics, or related disciplines.   Hours & Work Schedule:  Hours per Week:  40  Work Schedule:  Monday - Friday; 8:00 am - 5:00 pm       *This role can office anywhere in the Citizens Bank footprint  #LI-GB1       Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. [   Description    Do you enjoy being the face of an organization, engaging with customers to ensure they are fully satisfied? This is the heart of our Customer Service Teller role - delivering a memorable and personalized banking experience for each customer.        As the primary contact between our customers and the branch team, you will use great listening skills to engage closely with customers while processing customer service transactions accurately and efficiently. With an energetic attitude, you will get to know the customer, anticipate their needs, introduce them to financial products and services and make referrals to supporting branch colleagues as appropriate. You will serve as a peer coach and develop less experienced Customer Services Tellers while supporting branch leadership in maintaining a strong operational environment through the adherence of Citizens Bank policies and procedures.        This role is an opportunity to strengthen your consumer banking knowledge with paths to grow into other Retail, Business Banking and Wealth Management roles. As part of our team-oriented culture, you will be encouraged to develop new skills and grow into new career opportunities.         A Day in the Life of a Senior Customer Service Teller          Engage with customers to develop a positive customer experience; strive to make each customer interaction the best experience of their day    Provide exceptional customer service, accurately and efficiently processing customer service transactions    Build relationships with customers, anticipate their needs and educate and demonstrate for customers how to utilize the various customer preference options    Resolve customer problems and help customers to understand their banking options based on their personal preference for doing business with the bank    Serve as the primary contact between the branch and the majority of customers, making referrals for supporting retail banking colleagues as appropriate    Coach, mentor and develop less experienced Customer Service Tellers and support branch leadership in maintaining a strong operational environment    Adhere to all Citizens Bank policies and procedures; ensure fair treatment of customers and regulatory obligations    Support and contribute to satisfactory branch operational ratings and corporate audits while complying with federal, state and local laws    Bring a positive energy and confidence to Citizens Bank and its customers every day    Present a professional appearance as the face of Citizens      What can we offer you?      Strong recognition and incentive programs based on your achievements    Training, strategies and tools to support your personal growth and the development of strong customer relationships    Career growth opportunities in Retail, Business Banking or Wealth Management, including, but not limited to, Universal Banker, Small Business Relationship Banker, Licensed Relationship Banker and Branch Manager based on success in this front-line role    Collaborative workforce committed to supporting your ideas and feedback and accelerating your potential    Team atmosphere of diverse professionals committed to making an impact as an organization    Opportunities to volunteer and give back to our local communities    Exceptional benefits such as Medical & Dental, along with a 401K with corporate match     Qualifications     What qualifications are we looking for?      High School degree or GED required    Minimum of 1 year cash handling experience in a retail or banking environment    Minimum of 1 year demonstrated customer experience, recommending and referring products and services to customers    Strong listening and communication skills    Ability to effectively ask questions and identify needs to enhance the customer relationship    Commitment to build relationships through in-person customer interactions    Ability to problem solve and provide solutions to customer issues    Ability to build strong relationships with teammates, business partners and specialists through collaboration while coaching less experienced peers    Energetic, detail-oriented and ability to multitask effectively    Ability to work branch hours, which can include weekends and evenings       Hours and Work Schedule     Hours per Week: 40 Work Schedule: Varies with branch needs, will include evening and weekend hours         Be a great Citizen.  Join us today.                        Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth. [    Description    As an employee of Citizens Bank you become a part of an organization committed to serving customers, colleagues and communities in which we do business. Citizens Bank is an established and successful financial services company with a branch presence in 12 states and the ability to conduct business globally.  We are committed to offering comprehensive and competitive benefits, encouraging our colleagues to develop and grow their careers, and providing a fiscally sound and stable work environment while delivering to our customers.     Citizens Bank is honored to be a top Lender in the Mortgage sector and is focused on growing our market share in the states we currently operate. We are currently hiring talented Mortgage Loan Officers who proactively identify, develop and maintain a quality network of business relationships that serves as a source of referrals for new mortgage lending opportunities. External relationships are the cornerstone of generating new business and may consist of realtors, builders, professional and personal contacts. Our Loan Officers are encouraged to participate in business related development opportunities, community efforts to promote home ownership and professional organizations.  You will be responsible for interviewing new and existing customers to determine their loan needs and advising those customers of appropriate products, terms, and pricing, while gather any additional required information. It will be necessary to generate complete mortgage applications, ensuring appropriate procedures and policies are followed, while meeting sales goals and objectives.      As a Mortgage Loan Officer your primary responsibilities include:      Go above and beyond for customers:  Aspire to deliver world class customer service    Drive sales through service:  Achieve sales and referral goals by developing a positive customer experience    Build book of business:  Proactively seek ways to develop and expand customer relationships in order to contribute towards the branch success    Maximize personal productivity:  Desire to maximize personal productivity through attention to detail, self motivation, and adaptability to achieve branch and personal goals    Grow your own capabilities:  Actively participate in opportunities to expand knowledge, influencing and interpersonal skills          Qualifications      BA/BS degree or equivalent experience in residential mortgage sales preferred   Three plus years of retail residential mortgage sales experience   Documented residential mortgage loan volume in the past 12 months of $12 million (minimum)   Established relationships with local referral networks   Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing, across a variety of audiences   Strong computer skills and experience utilizing laptop technology   Successful candidate must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks and obtaining a Unique Identifier from the NMLS.      Hours & Work Schedule      Hours per Week:   Work Schedule:          Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth. [   Description    Citizens Bank is seeking a motivated, highly successful, proven Relationship Manager with experience in moderately to less complex portfolios, and a strong grasp of sales and credit skills. This senior level performer is expected to be able to have an immediate impact. We reward you with an uncapped incentive opportunity and the ability to grow your career with a world class organization.         Responsibilities          Develop consultative relationships with small business clients in your target market with annual revenues ranging from $500K-$5MM.    Understand the client needs, provide value added solutions, manage a portfolio of existing customers and drive new commercial customer relationships.    Partner effectively with an award winning business banking team offering a  wide array of product solutions that will enable you to enhance the customer experience, increase loyalty and improve the profitability of customer and the Bank    Complete Business Banking University and Drive Sales training in your initial four week orientation and a commercial credit training program to insure youâ€™re prepared to identify, assess and mitigate lending risk. Ability to develop strong customer and colleague relationships.           Education      Bachelors Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience, required. [    Description      The Senior Business System Analyst (BSA) leads and coordinates key projects/initiatives within Business Banking Operations (BBOps) with knowledge of business processes, products, and core systems. The candidate interfaces with operation managers, business partners, and technology resources to ensure business needs are captured and aids in the translation of business requirements to technical requirements and/or support. The Senior BSA must partner with all levels of the BBOps organization, organize and direct resources, drive results, proactively identify and resolve problems. The candidate will contribute to organizational improvements by gathering and analyzing data, preparing reports, and identifying process improvements through reporting and business analysis. Responsible for the successful planning, overseeing, and leading multiple projects simultaneously from initiation through to completion.                Primary responsibilities include :         Provide integrated business and system analysis within their domain and identify how application/systems interact to support business processes.      Conduct and coordinate financial, operational and related research to support strategic and business planning with various Business Banking Operations teams.      Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring project performance.      Liaise with management team, and technology resources to ensure successful system implementations, upgrades, and testing.      Design and develop daily/weekly/monthly metrics, reports, and perform analyses of business processes to support operation managers and senior leader with strategic decision-making.      Develop, maintain, and implement enhanced spreadsheets and databasesâ€™ functionality like usage of templates, VBA macros, and logic functions.                 Qualifications     Required Skills/Experience:       5 years experience as a System Analyst, Business Analyst, or similar capacity       Strong project management skills, ability to successfully manage multiple tasks at any given point, strong relationship building skills & communication skills      Ability to analyze and troubleshoot reports, ensure data accuracy and timeliness, interpret and analyze data to guide strategic and tactical business decisions.      Competent use of Microsoft Office applications to include Microsoft Visio, PowerPoint, and Word      Experience with Excel and VBA macros, and enhanced spreadsheets.      Self thinker able to work through issues and escalate only when appropriate.      Excellent written and verbal communication skills      Exceptional communication organizational and skills         Self starter with the capacity to work independently with minimal supervision             Able to effectively liaise with relationship managers, legal counsel, third party vendors and external customers           Preferred Skills/Experience:      Bachelor's Degree is preferred       Hours and Work Schedule:       Hours per Week: 40     Work Schedule: 8:00am -5:00pm, Monday - Friday                    #LI-AP1                    Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. [   Description    Are you looking to jumpstart a rewarding career in banking but arenâ€™t sure how to get started?      Discover an exciting opportunity to take your career to the next level as part of our Associate Licensed Relationship Banker program. This is a unique opportunity for customer focused professionals looking to secure the licenses needed for our Licensed Relationship Banker career. As part of this program, you will develop your skills and obtain licensing to help customers save, spend, borrow and plan for retirement.     As an Associate Licensed Relationship Banker, you will be developing in the role of a banker while studying for the required licenses. Once licensed with your Series 6, 63, Life and Health licenses, you will move to the Licensed Relationship Banker role and have dual responsibilities in both banking and investments.       A Day in the Life of an Associate Licensed Relationship Banker     Work closely with new and existing customers to understand their financial needs and deepen relationships  Provide recommendations and assist customers with a wide-array of financial solutions to help them save, spend, borrow and plan for retirement  Leverage problem-solving and strong communication skills to resolve customer issues  Collaborate with branch colleagues and partners to support and refer customers with more complex financial needs   Ensure compliance  with all financial policies, procedures and regulatory requirements  Achieve outstanding performance  by going above and beyond for customers each day  Be the face of Citizens Bank, presenting a professional, friendly and helpful appearance with every interaction  Take part in our Paid Study Program to obtain Series 6, 63, Life and Health licenses needed to advance to the Licensed Relationship Banker role     What can we offer you?      Ongoing support and guidance such as on-the-job learning, hands-on experience and mentorship  Paid study time, study materials and a testing window to secure your Series 6, 63, Life and Health licenses as part of the program  Strong recognition and incentive plans to accelerate you earning potential based on your achievements  Opportunities to develop your career and grow into new roles, such as a Licensed Relationship Banker, Premier Relationship Manager, Branch Manager or Financial Consultant   Training, strategies and tools to support your personal growth and the development of strong customer relationships  Collaborative workforce committed to supporting your ideas and feedback and accelerating your potential  Team atmosphere of diverse professionals committed to making an impact as an organization  Opportunities to volunteer and give back to our local communities  Exceptional benefits such as Medical & Dental, along with a 401K with corporate match       Qualifications     What qualifications are we looking for?      College degree in business related field or in lieu of education a High School degree or GED with 2 years of customer service experience.  You are required to obtain all required licenses as part of our Paid Study Program. Licenses must be obtained in the following order: Series 6 license; Series 63 license; Life/Health Insurance licenses  Ability to effectively engage with customers and identify needs to enhance the customer relationship   Exceptional listening and communication skills, ability to present features and benefits of products and services to customers with differing needs  Ability to problem solve and provide solutions to customer issues  A track record of working effectively in a team environment and building solid relationships with teammates, business partners and specialists through collaboration  Self-motivated, confident, and ability to multitask effectively   Willingness to work branch hours, which can include weekends and evenings   If selected, candidates must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks and obtaining a Unique Identifier from the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS). [    Description          The primary focus of the role will be to identify and effect process improvements and automations, through collaboration, data analytics and customer journey mapping techniques, to enhance client experience and deliver improved operational efficiency and effectiveness. High School degree or GED required   Minimum of 1 year cash handling experience strongly preferred   2 years of sales and customer service experience   Strong listening and customer service skills  Ability to effectively ask questions and identify needs to enhance the customer relationship   Commitment to building relationships through phone engagements  Ability to problem solve and provide solutions to customer issues  Ability to strengthen relationships with teammates, business partners and specialists through collaboration  Self-motivated, confident and ability to multitask effectively  Ability to work branch hours, which can include weekends and evenings  If selected, candidates must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks and obtaining a Unique Identifier from the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS).             Hours and Work Schedule    Hours per Week: 40  Work Schedule: Varies based on branch schedule and  needs, Monday through Friday and may include Saturdays      Be a great Citizen.     Join us today.                 Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth. [   Description    Do you enjoy being the face of an organization, engaging with customers to ensure they are fully satisfied? This is the heart of our Customer Service Teller role - delivering a memorable and personalized banking experience for each customer.        As the primary contact between our customers and the branch team, you will use great listening skills to engage closely with customers while processing customer service transactions accurately and efficiently. With an energetic attitude, you will get to know the customer, anticipate their needs, introduce them to financial products and services and make referrals to supporting branch colleagues as appropriate. You will serve as a peer coach and develop less experienced Customer Services Tellers while supporting branch leadership in maintaining a strong operational environment through the adherence of Citizens Bank policies and procedures.        This role is an opportunity to strengthen your consumer banking knowledge with paths to grow into other Retail, Business Banking and Wealth Management roles. As part of our team-oriented culture, you will be encouraged to develop new skills and grow into new career opportunities.         A Day in the Life of a Senior Customer Service Teller          Engage with customers to develop a positive customer experience; strive to make each customer interaction the best experience of their day    Provide exceptional customer service, accurately and efficiently processing customer service transactions    Build relationships with customers, anticipate their needs and educate and demonstrate for customers how to utilize the various customer preference options    Resolve customer problems and help customers to understand their banking options based on their personal preference for doing business with the bank    Serve as the primary contact between the branch and the majority of customers, making referrals for supporting retail banking colleagues as appropriate    Coach, mentor and develop less experienced Customer Service Tellers and support branch leadership in maintaining a strong operational environment    Adhere to all Citizens Bank policies and procedures; ensure fair treatment of customers and regulatory obligations    Support and contribute to satisfactory branch operational ratings and corporate audits while complying with federal, state and local laws    Bring a positive energy and confidence to Citizens Bank and its customers every day    Present a professional appearance as the face of Citizens      What can we offer you?      Strong recognition and incentive programs based on your achievements    Training, strategies and tools to support your personal growth and the development of strong customer relationships    Career growth opportunities in Retail, Business Banking or Wealth Management, including, but not limited to, Universal Banker, Small Business Relationship Banker, Licensed Relationship Banker and Branch Manager based on success in this front-line role    Collaborative workforce committed to supporting your ideas and feedback and accelerating your potential    Team atmosphere of diverse professionals committed to making an impact as an organization    Opportunities to volunteer and give back to our local communities    Exceptional benefits such as Medical & Dental, along with a 401K with corporate match     Qualifications     What qualifications are we looking for?      High School degree or GED required    Minimum of 1 year cash handling experience in a retail or banking environment    Minimum of 1 year demonstrated customer experience, recommending and referring products and services to customers    Strong listening and communication skills    Ability to effectively ask questions and identify needs to enhance the customer relationship    Commitment to build relationships through in-person customer interactions    Ability to problem solve and provide solutions to customer issues    Ability to build strong relationships with teammates, business partners and specialists through collaboration while coaching less experienced peers    Energetic, detail-oriented and ability to multitask effectively    Ability to work branch hours, which can include weekends and evenings    Bilingual in Spanish is required     Hours and Work Schedule     Hours per Week: 40 Work Schedule: Varies with branch needs and may include weekends and evenings         Be a great Citizen. [    Description    As a Branch Manager, youâ€™ll operate as business leaders and be responsible for coaching and building your team in a profit and loss environment. You determine the success of your branch by recruiting top talent with the ability to forecast staffing needs. In this role you will inspire, model and motivate service through staff coaching and training to achieve a superior customer experience. The Branch Manager prioritizes, manages, and communicates promotional campaigns and product initiatives. Fosters a motivated, diverse team environment; by setting employees up for success establishing clear objectives for the branch and for each employee. The Branch Manager is responsible for branch compliance with bank policies, procedures, and operational integrity. Maintains and develops relationships with existing small business customers and creating great partnerships within Citizens and the community. Creates and manages to the branch business plan profit and loss. Will deploy all resources to optimize individual, team performance and team development plan management.     Reports to the Retail Branch Regional Manager     Success in this front-line role can lead to both short and long term career opportunities in Retail, Business Banking or Wealth Management, including, but not limited to, Regional Sales Manager and District Sales Manager.      As a Branch Manager your primary responsibilities include:      Create a Service Environment:  Build and promote branch identity, drive sales and promote overall ownership and accountability for improving customer service and branch success.    Manage a High Performing Team:  Show accountability by taking ownership of the business and willingness to make customer-focused decisions when needed.    Provide sales leadership to ensure franchise growth:  Leading by example, through accountability, reward and recognition to drive outstanding sales and service results.    Ensure our customers are extremely satisfied  with every interaction â€“ make it memorable and the best part of their day.    Coach and Develop to Drive Results:  Assist colleagues in achieving their developmental goals and career aspirations.    Bring a positive energy and confidence to Citizens every day. For an Evergreen position your assigned location will be determined within 90 days and could be in an In-Store or Traditional branch    Education, Certifications and/or Other Professional Credentials:    Associateâ€™s or Bachelorâ€™s degree preferred   High School Diploma or equivalent required     Success Factors     Knowledge, skills & abilities that typically lead to success in the job include:  Holding others accountable  Coaching  Inspiring  Team Leadership  Customer service  Risk acumen  Business partnering  Problem solving  Retail banking  Talent sourcing & assessment     Hours & Work Schedule      Hours per Week: 40  Work Schedule:  Varies with branch needs          Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. [   Description    Citizens Bank is seeking a motivated, highly successful, proven Relationship Manager with experience in moderately to less complex portfolios, and a strong grasp of sales and credit skills. This senior level performer is expected to be able to have an immediate impact. We reward you with an uncapped incentive opportunity and the ability to grow your career with a world class organization.         Responsibilities          Develop consultative relationships with small business clients in your target market with annual revenues ranging from $500K-$5MM.    Understand the client needs, provide value added solutions, manage a portfolio of existing customers and drive new commercial customer relationships.    Partner effectively with an award winning business banking team offering a  wide array of product solutions that will enable you to enhance the customer experience, increase loyalty and improve the profitability of customer and the Bank    Complete Business Banking University and Drive Sales training in your initial four week orientation and a commercial credit training program to insure youâ€™re prepared to identify, assess and mitigate lending risk.    Maintain strong market knowledge and develop, retain and expand relationships with Centers of Influence ie. CPAâ€™s and Attorneys.    Actively engage in meaningful community activity to expand potential customer base. Motivated self starter with demonstrated leadership ability and potential.    Successfully operate in a â€œteamâ€ atmosphere building upon and leveraging strong internal and external network.    Ability to succeed in a fast paced, demanding sales culture with measured routines and goals aimed at new loan and deposit generation, cross sales, customer service and satisfaction    Proficiency with portfolio/account management preferred.    Ability to understand core business products and services. Proven track record of sales and outside calling skills.    Excellent communication (written & verbal) and interpersonal skills.    Ability to develop strong customer and colleague relationships.           Education      Bachelors Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience, required. [ Description

As an early career professional, you have the chance to jumpstart your career growth by applying to our unique, multi-tie red development program. Through comprehensive training and exposure to bank leaders, you will develop a skillset that will pave the way for a fulfilling career. This opportunity gives you the tools you need to grow into a future leader at Citizens Bank.

As part of the Licensed Relationship Banker Development Program, you will develop meaningful relationships with our customers by understanding their financial needs and helping them to save, spend, borrow and prepare to retire. The first step is a four-month licensing process with coaching from a supportive team around you, which will give you invaluable skills and expertise to succeed as a Licensed Relationship Banker. The Licensed Relationship Banker Development Program is the gateway to a fulfilling career in banking.

Program Features:

  • Robust 12-month program catered to your professional growth and development
  • Opportunity to engage with customers to fully understand their financial needs and help customers with their saving, spending and borrowing needs, as well as helping them plan for retirement
  • Ability for you to secure FINRA Series 6 and Series 63 licenses and state-specific Life & Health Insurance Licenses
  • Kaplan study materials and 200+ hours of paid study to earn the required licenses
  • Exposure to leadership within both the wealth and retail side, and opportunities to partner with sales executives within the mortgage, wealth, and business banking divisions
  • Connecticut, Delaware, Massachusetts, Michigan, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York (upstate), Ohio, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, and Vermont locations
  • Annual 2-day welcome event to include development, networking opportunities, recognition and fun!
  • Comprehensive training within a supportive and collaborative environment
  • Dedicated mentor to support your career growth
  • Enhanced $1000 college referral program during your first year
  • Opportunity to job shadow twice a year to help you identify your career path
  • Opportunities to volunteer throughout the year with your fellow colleagues

    Key Tasks and Responsibilities of the role include, but are not limited to:

  • Working closely with new and existing customers to understand their financial needs and deepen relationships
  • Providing advice to assist customers with a wide-array of financial solutions to help them meet their financial goals
  • Leveraging problem-solving and strong communication skills to resolve customer issues
  • Collaborating with branch colleagues and partners to support and refer customers with more complex financial needs
  • Ensuring compliance with all financial policies, procedures and regulatory requirements
  • Achieving outstanding performance by going above and beyond for customers each day
  • Being the face of Citizens Bank, presenting a professional, friendly and helpful appearance with every interaction Qualifications

    What qualifications are we looking for?

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree with an expected graduation date no later than Spring 2019, or recent alumni (0-2 years out)
  • GPA of 3.0 preferred
  • Ability to effectively engage with customers and identify needs to enhance the customer relationship
  • Exceptional listening and communication skills, ability to present features and benefits of products and services to customers with differing needs
  • Ability to problem solve and provide solutions to customer issues
  • Self-motivated, confident, and ability to multitask effectively
  • Willingness to work branch hours, which can include weekends and evenings
  • If selected, candidates must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks and obtaining a Unique Identifier from the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS)

    Hours and Work Schedule

    Hours per Week: 40 Work Schedule: Varies with branch needs and may include weekends and evenings

    Available Locations

    Connecticut

    Delaware

    Massachusetts

    Michigan

    New Hampshire

    New Jersey

    New York

    Ohio

    Pennsylvania

    Rhode Island

    Vermont

    Why Work with Us

    At Citizens, youâ€™ll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth.

column2: [    Description    The Premier Advisor is a key role within our Wealth Management division and is responsible for delivering personalized financial strategies to affluent clientele through banking and borrowing needs, as well as, investments services. The incumbent will have responsibility and accountability to service a portfolio of affluent households with investable assets of $500, 000 or more. The primary objective of this trusted advisor is to grow client assets, retain and acquire new clients through being the single point of contact for all banking needs. The Premier Advisor will be required to maintain compliance with all Citizens Financial Group policies and procedures, as well as, regulatory and legal requirements. This role will require a holistic delivery of outstanding service and sales solutions to meet clientsâ€™ financial needs and goals.     Relationship Management:    Develop and deepen long term relationships with existing clientsâ€™ through proactive and regular contact in order to gain loyalty and deepen share of wallet.  Provide high-level customer service to clients by addressing and resolving issues/concerns and coordinating client service activities within other areas of the organization.  Develop and maintain relationships with external partners in the communities served.  Become the trusted advisor to clients, through consistency, credibility, and responsiveness.  Expand and maintain relationships with internal business partners, to include, financial consultant, business banker, loan officer, and retail branch manager.    Business Development:     Acquire, grow and manage a profitable portfolio of affluent client households.  Contribute to profit, sales and product targets of the Retail and Wealth Management Division by selling appropriate financial solutions and banking services to the portfolio of clients.  Expand the size and quality of the client base through initiating new relationships.  Expand number of relationships through referrals and provide referrals to other bank specialists.  Continually build knowledge and capabilities within the industry segment and stay current with competitive trends.         Qualifications      Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business or Finance preferred or relevant equivalent experience.  4-6 years of banking experience preferred.  Experience with sales of consumer mortgage and home equity recommended.  Experience with sales of banking products and services required.  Experience with investment product referrals and sales preferred.  Knowledgeable of regulatory requirements to ensure a sound control environment.  FINRA Series 6 or 7 and 63 Securities License required; Series 65 or 66 and Life/Health Insurance licenses within 30 days.  Successful candidate must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks and obtaining a Unique Identifier from the NMLS.    Hours and Work Schedule  Hours per Week: 40  Work Schedule: Monday - Friday                                Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth. [    Description      As part of Corporate Finance, the Finance Risk & SOX provides organizational governance and SOX oversight across the Bank, in a very dynamic environment. The successful candidate will:      Work under the direction of Finance Risk & SOX Manager and in collaboration with Finance Risk Members & Senior SOX Analysts.      Interface with business line colleagues in various functions, such as Commercial, Consumer Lending, Financial Reporting, and Information Technology, etc. to assist in gaining an understanding of how the functions are carried out and to ensure that operational, financial reporting, and disclosure risks are appropriately identified and addressed by adequately designed controls.      Assist and perform effectiveness testing of these controls, assessing potential deficiencies, communicating results, and working with business lines to ensure that deficiencies are timely and thoroughly remediated.      Challenge the status quo in order to enhance the procedures and/or controls of the Bank.      This position will provide exposure to a wide range of Bank operations and management, as well as participate in ad-hoc special projects with not only departmental, but Bank-wide impact.       Qualifications     Highly motivated team player, results-driven, analytical, detail-oriented, and deadline-focused     1-3 yearsâ€™ experience in external or internal audit, accounting, risk or information technology; preferably with a public company in the banking and financial services industry.       Fully proficient in PC tools (Microsoft Office).        Good organizational, as well as written and verbal communication skills. [    Description    As a Branch Manager, youâ€™ll operate as business leaders and be responsible for coaching and building your team in a profit and loss environment. You determine the success of your branch by recruiting top talent with the ability to forecast staffing needs. In this role you will inspire, model and motivate service through staff coaching and training to achieve a superior customer experience. The Branch Manager prioritizes, manages, and communicates promotional campaigns and product initiatives. Fosters a motivated, diverse team environment; by setting employees up for success establishing clear objectives for the branch and for each employee. The Branch Manager is responsible for branch compliance with bank policies, procedures, and operational integrity. Maintains and develops relationships with existing small business customers and creating great partnerships within Citizens and the community. Creates and manages to the branch business plan profit and loss. Will deploy all resources to optimize individual, team performance and team development plan management. [    Description    As an employee of Citizens Bank you become a part of an organization committed to serving customers, colleagues and communities in which we do business. Citizens Bank is an established and successful financial services company with national presence and the ability to conduct business globally.  We are committed to offering comprehensive and competitive benefits, encouraging our colleagues to develop and grow their careers, and providing a fiscally sound and stable work environment while delivering to our customers.        As a Business Banking Healthcare Relationship Manager I, your primary responsibilities will include:     Primary focus is on exceeding specific net portfolio loan and deposit growth goals along with new deposit, loan, cash management and total revenue production.     Products marketed include but are not limited to: deposit, credit, interest and currency risk management products, cash management, international trade and liquidity solutions.     Incumbents usually handle complex accounts and sensitive client relationships and are trusted to handle negotiations and credit assessments on an independent basis.     Ability to source, structure and present business lending opportunities up to $10MM.    Effectively utilize centralized credit support team for both new originations and portfolio management.     Develop a targeted COI (center of influence) list and have a detailed plan to build relationships that lead to referral business to achieve goals.     Build a collaborative internal relationship with key partners (assigned Business Banking RMs, branches, investment specialist, cash management, mortgage specialist, insurance specialist, your place banking, etc.).     Introduce top clients to appropriate specialist to deepen share of wallet. Joint calling and prospecting with specialists depending on situation.     Utilize salesforce.com to manage your call/relationship management activities on a weekly basis.     Required to make a targeted number of â€œin personâ€ calls to prospects, customers, Centers of Influences and internal partners weekly & monthly.     Practice sounds risk management protocols and adhere to internal and regulatory requirements.     Qualifications     1-3+ years in a Business Banking Relationship Manager role or related business lending experience.     Healthcare experience preferred.     Bachelors Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.     Advanced knowledge of  business products and services     Proven track record of sales and outside calling skills     Excellent communication (written & verbal) and interpersonal skills     Ability to develop strong customer and colleague relationships     Local market knowledge and the ability to develop, retain and expand relationships with Centers of Influence    Meaningful community involvement           Hours & Work Schedule            Hours per Week:  40    Work Schedule:  Monday - Friday, 8:00AM - 5:00PM       Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities.
