[    Description   The Solution Architecture Director will lead a community of practice of Solution Architects to enable the delivery of cost effective solutions that are aligned with the enterprise architecture and standards, meets our regulatory and compliance requirements and meets or exceeds the goal of the business. This role will incorporate a strong consultant oriented approach working across business and technology teams to execute against a strategy and deliver results.  The Solution Architecture Director will be responsible for:   Creation and maintenance of a consolidated technology catalog for estimation and planning and driving project adoption of standards for accelerated delivery of solutions.  Overseeing the governance required at applicable stage gates for project delivery.  Overseeing detailed design review and ensuring execution against the approved solution design that may involve application/system architecture and process designs for integration of large complex IT solutions.  Driving a continuous improvement culture in the cost and time to deliver the technical solutions in our catalog.  Identifying needed technical capabilities and influencing the technology strategy & technology investments that will realize the business strategy.  Influence vendors & partners.  Lead and/or assist efforts to scope and architect major change programs, leading strategic options analysis & proposing end-to-end solutions & highlighting trade-offs.  Ensure projects align with strategic capabilities, target architectures & technology standards.       Qualifications   Required Qualifications:    Bachelor's degree in computer science, systems analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience.    Seven to 10 years of experience in at least two IT disciplines (such as technical architecture, network management, application development, middleware, information analysis, database management or operations) in a multitier environment.    Demonstrated management of architecture organization and leading virtual teams made up of business and technology resources.    Strong communication and influencing skills with business & technology subject matter experts.    Exposure to multiple, diverse technologies and processing environments.    Ability to translate business needs into solution architecture requirements.    Knowledge of all components of an enterprise technical architecture.    Ability to estimate the financial impact of solution architecture alternatives.    Ability to apply multiple technical solutions to business problems.    Strong organizational skills with a demonstrated ability to plan and prioritize workload    Strong communication and influencing skills with business & technology executives (Director of Technology, CTO, COO, CIO, Business Division Leads)       Preferred Qualifications:    Experience working with the design, integration and/or support of vendor packages within an overall enterprise architecture.    Working knowledge of the Financial Services industry in either Consumer / Retail Banking (e.g. digital transformation, consumer lending) & Commercial Banking (e.g. capital markets, transaction banking).    Working knowledge of Enterprise Architecture frameworks & industry models (TOGAF, ITIL and BIAN).    Experience working in Agile delivery (ie Scrum)    Knowledge of business process re-engineering principles and processes.    Demonstrated experience of identifying and leading forward process improvements.      Hours and Work Schedule  Hours per Week: 40  Work Schedule: 8:00am - 5:00pm; Monday - Friday     #LI-GK1          Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. The Financial Consultant I strives to meet and exceed identified sales goals.  The Financial Consultant I will proactively engage potential new clients to promote and sell investment products and services, while developing strong working relationships with branch personnel in an assigned territory. [    Description   Citizens Bank is currently searching for an SBA Business Development Officer to join our Business Banking Team. As a SBA Business Development Officer, you will be responsible for sourcing, identifying, and closing new loan opportunities using the SBA 7(a) and 504 loan programs. Establishing and maintaining a proven network of referral sources from which one can generate a sufficient number of new opportunities to promote the origination of SBA loans in an assigned market will be a primary focus of the position. In addition, you will play a key role in building collaborative relationships with our internal partners across Business Banking, while delivering an exceptional customer experience designed to grow our SBA loan portfolio. Developing and implementing a personal business plan and marketing strategy to aid in identifying areas of opportunity for new business penetration, and the creation of a solid contact base of current and potential referral sources.  Working with internal partners to assist in structuring, presenting, and guiding lending opportunities through the application, underwriting, and closing process to ensure that all SBA requirements are met.  Maintaining and applying a thorough understanding of bank credit policy and underwriting guidelines while working with Business Credit Services and operations to practice sound risk management and adherence to applicable regulatory requirements.   Active participation in local SBA district events and functions within assigned geographic markets . Thorough knowledge and understanding of SBA Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), program eligibility, credit criteria and loan structure requirements.  Proven track record of sales and outside calling skills.  Local market knowledge and the ability to develop, retain and expand relationships with Centers of Influence.  Professional organization, interpersonal and communication skills - both written and verbal.  Proficient in MS Office applications and familiarity with the Saleforce CRM Platform.   Education   BS Degree or Higher in Business, Finance, Economics, or related disciplines. Treasuryâ€™s key responsibilities are to manage Funding and Liquidity Risk, Structural Market Risk, especially Interest Rate Risk in the Banking Book, Capital Management and Recovery & Resolution Planning.         Specific departments within Treasury include: Funding and Liquidity, Asset/Liability Management, Capital Markets, Treasury Investments and Hedges, Deposit Strategy or Treasury Finance, Capital Strategy & Analytics, Capital Management Delivery, Resolution & Recovery Planning.         The incumbent will be trained for three six month increments in pre-determined department within Treasury and upon successful completion of the rotations be placed in one of the areas. The incumbent will complete rotations in the Boston and/or Providence, RI location and be placed permanently in either Providence, RI or Boston, MA.     Qualifications      Masters degree in economics, math, finance or business administration  Minimum GPA of 3.5  Minimum of 5 years previous experience as a Financial/ Business Analyst  Strong analytical background and intellectual curiosity  Fully proficient in PC tools (Microsoft Office)  Exceptional written and oral presentation skills    Hours and Work Schedule  Hours per Week: 40  Work Schedule: M-F 8:30am - 5pm         Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth. column2: [    Description    The Premier Advisor is a key role within our Wealth Management division and is responsible for delivering personalized financial strategies to affluent clientele through banking and borrowing needs, as well as, investments services. The incumbent will have responsibility and accountability to service a portfolio of affluent households with investable assets of $500, 000 or more. The primary objective of this trusted advisor is to grow client assets, retain and acquire new clients through being the single point of contact for all banking needs. The Premier Advisor will be required to maintain compliance with all Citizens Financial Group policies and procedures, as well as, regulatory and legal requirements. This role will require a holistic delivery of outstanding service and sales solutions to meet clientsâ€™ financial needs and goals.     Relationship Management:    Develop and deepen long term relationships with existing clientsâ€™ through proactive and regular contact in order to gain loyalty and deepen share of wallet.  Provide high-level customer service to clients by addressing and resolving issues/concerns and coordinating client service activities within other areas of the organization.  Develop and maintain relationships with external partners in the communities served.  Become the trusted advisor to clients, through consistency, credibility, and responsiveness.  Expand and maintain relationships with internal business partners, to include, financial consultant, business banker, loan officer, and retail branch manager.    Business Development:     Acquire, grow and manage a profitable portfolio of affluent client households.  Contribute to profit, sales and product targets of the Retail and Wealth Management Division by selling appropriate financial solutions and banking services to the portfolio of clients.  Expand the size and quality of the client base through initiating new relationships.  Expand number of relationships through referrals and provide referrals to other bank specialists.  Continually build knowledge and capabilities within the industry segment and stay current with competitive trends.         Qualifications      Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business or Finance preferred or relevant equivalent experience.  4-6 years of banking experience preferred.  Experience with sales of consumer mortgage and home equity recommended.  Experience with sales of banking products and services required.  Experience with investment product referrals and sales preferred.  Knowledgeable of regulatory requirements to ensure a sound control environment.  FINRA Series 6 or 7 and 63 Securities License required; Series 65 or 66 and Life/Health Insurance licenses within 30 days.  Successful candidate must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks and obtaining a Unique Identifier from the NMLS.                   Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth. [    Description     If you are a current college student, you have the chance to jumpstart your career by joining one of the internship programs at Citizens Bank.  Our   internship programs give you the chance to work on a variety of critical business assignments that will test your skills and use your academic knowledge.  For many of our successful interns, these opportunities often lead to full-time job offers.      Citizens Bank is looking for highly motivated and talented individuals for the  Internal Audit Internship.  The Internal Audit department is staffed by over 100 skilled professionals with a mission of consistently providing  the Board, Audit Committee, Shareholders, and Executive Management with an independent and objective view of the effectiveness of the Bankâ€™s control environment, risk management practices, and culture.  As an Intern in Internal Audit,  you will participate in various activities which provide  independent assurance on the appropriateness of the design and operational effectiveness of risk management and internal control processes that mitigate key risks.   Under the supervision of a member of the Internal Audit team, you will assess risk in line with bank policy, industry standards, and regulatory requirements and take on assignments to support the completion of audits.           Internal Audit Internship starts in early JUNE 2019       Primary responsibilities include:    Participate in various audit activities, such as reviewing relevant background material or analyzing data, documenting meeting notes, or preparing and/or updating process maps, to identify risks and controls of the area being audited.    Execute testing of controls, documenting test steps taken and summarizing testing results during audits or issue validation activities.      Adhere to IA Methodology and bank policies and procedures     Performs various ad hoc requests, such as data input or analysis, as needed      Qualifications    Self-starter and self-motivated  Excellent interpersonal and verbal/written communication skills  Strong analytical skills  Team player who can work closely with others to complete projects under pressure with limited time and resources  Proficient in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint)    Education:     Currently pursuing a bachelorâ€™s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Information Technology, or related degree  Preferred  graduation date of May 2020  Minimum GPA of 3.0      Hours & Work Schedule   Hours per Week:  40  Work Schedule:  Monday - Friday, 8:30 am - 5:00 pm      Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. [    Description    If you are a current college student, you have the chance to jumpstart your career by joining one of the internship programs at Citizens Bank.  Our internship programs give you the chance to work on a variety of critical business assignments that will test your skills and use your academic knowledge.  For many of our successful interns, these opportunities often lead to full-time job offers.      Over the course of 10-weeks, youâ€™ll experience a variety of hands-on, impactful projects, gain exposure to senior executives, be matched to a mentor, and develop a transferable skill-set that will position you as a possible candidate for the Consumer Banking Leadership Development Program (CBLDP). Designed for rising seniors, our Summer Internship Program is a great way to develop new skills within a specific Consumer Banking line of business.       Program Information:         â€¢ Locations may include: Dedham, MA, Westwood, MA, Warwick, RI, Johnston, RI, East Providence, RI, Providence, RI or other potential locations  â€¢ Program begins with a thorough introduction to banking, financials, and overall strategy  â€¢ Summer Interns are placed in one specific Consumer Banking line of business (potential placements listed below), dependent upon business need  â€¢ Project presentations (e.g. developing strategy to accelerate migration of deposit transactions from the branch to ATMs) to be delivered to executive leadership at Program end  â€¢ Exposure to senior leadership, executives, customers and community partners through panels, meetings, trainings, networking events, and volunteer opportunities  â€¢ Participants are assigned a formal mentor (CBLDP alum) to help guide you through the Program      Early consideration for the Consumer Banking Leadership Development Program (CBLDP) is available to Summer Interns. High performers interested in pursuing a career in Consumer Banking will have an opportunity to interview for the CBLDP before the summer ends.        Potential placements may be available in the following lines of business:       Business Banking: Business Banking offers numerous products/services to small businesses and institutional customers (e.g. Checking, Savings, Lending, Credit Cards). Acting as a trusted partner, Business Banking caters to customers looking to grow and manage their businesses in the market.       Citizens Access (Direct Bank): Citizens Access, a division of Citizens Bank, is a nationwide, direct-to-consumer platform for digitally-savvy consumers who value the flexibility and convenience of online savings offering highly competitive rates with no fees (e.g. savings, CD, CD ladder).      Consumer Deposits & Lending: Consumer Deposits & Lending offers numerous products/services to individual customers (e.g. Auto Finance, Home Equity, and Student Lending). In addition, the business strives to understand the full end-to-end experience, including how to drive efficient operations, how to market the programs that drive activation, and overall usage of the products offered at the Bank.      Consumer Marketing & Strategy: Consumer Marketing & Strategy is responsible for the alignment between the brand, strategy, marketing, and data. Comprised of multiple teams such as Consumer Strategy, Digital & Multi-Channel Marketing, Customer Experience, and Analytics, the team works to drive business activities forward by providing each line of business with a unique and differentiated strategy.       Distribution: Distribution leads the Citizens Bank Retail Banking branch network, as well as our sales, strategy, and development which is responsible for equipping our front-line colleagues with tools and resources to deliver an exceptional customer experience. Through in-person discussions, our branch colleagues strive to understand our customersâ€™ needs, advise them on how to achieve their financial goals, and build strong personal connections.      Wealth Management: Citizens Wealth Management strives to provide a highly competitive, multi-segment integrated banking experience and investing products/services to its customers. By providing personal service and objective guidance, Wealth Management helps clients make the most of their money through our banking and investing services in order to help them meet their financial goals.       NOTE: THIS PROGRAM BEGINS IN EARLY JUNE 2019         Qualifications    â€¢ Self-starter and self-motivated  â€¢ Excellent interpersonal skills  â€¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills  â€¢ Strong analytical and technical skills  â€¢ Detail-oriented   â€¢ Ability to present effectively and persuade others  â€¢ Team player who can work closely with others to complete projects under pressure with limited time and resources       Education Requirements:       â€¢ Currently pursuing a Bachelorâ€™s degree with demonstrated academic achievement  â€¢ Expected graduation date of May 2020  â€¢ All majors will be considered; coursework in Finance, Accounting, Economics, and Marketing beneficial, but not required  â€¢ GPA: 3.0+ required, 3.2+ preferred                        Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth. column2: [    Description    The Training Director will manage and oversee the delivery of the learning strategy for Citizens Commercial Bank. As part of Citizens Learning and Development team, this role will consult with key business leaders and HR partners to ensure the learning and development needs of the business are met, including all technical, sales, product, and professional skills.      Responsibilities include:    Building relationships with all business partners to foster a common understanding of mutual goals  Developing  and executing the learning strategy based on a deep understanding of the business priorities and linkage to the talent agenda to ensure the businessâ€™ success  Leading a team of both directs and non-directs to execute on the learning strategy  Identifying desired training/development outcomes with tracking and reporting to business constituents regarding outcomes, impacts and participation.  Pro-actively anticipating the needs of the Commercial Bank and translating those needs to learning and development  Conducting, leading or supervising projects that require needs assessments of current and future training requirements, as requested by the Chief Learning Officer  Communicating organizational initiatives at stakeholder meetings.  Conducting direct observations of Team facilitating training to identify gaps and areas of development  Coordinating, scheduling and supervising on-the-job assessments to specifically identify effectiveness of training curriculum in on-the-job environment, making appropriate recommendations based on assessment  Partnering with the business lines to recommend, select and work closely with vendors to insure execution of the training  Opportunity to work in other areas of Development supporting the Commercial teams.      The chosen candidate may work in our corporate offices within Stamford, CT, Boston/Dedham, MA or Providence RI with our preferred location being our Boston, MA location.  Candidates will be required to travel to Rhode Island and Connecticut as needed.         Qualifications   Experience and Skills     10 or more years of Training / Business experience, preferably in Financial Services, ideally in Commercial Banking  Background in creating and implementing business specific professional development curriculums  Ability to think strategically incorporating multiple pieces of data while executing tactically  Superior facilitation and presentation skills; excellent written and communication skills  Training and leading the dissemination of resources  Strong organizational and influence skills  Self-motivated  Internal Consulting, Need Assessment, Design and Development experience  Ability to travel as required     Education, Certifications and/or Other Professional Credentials     BA/BS Degree required in relevant field or equivalent work experience, Masterâ€™s degree in relevant field preferred (Education in Training, Needs Assessment and Design and Development)        Hours & Work Schedule  Hours per Week:   40  Work Schedule:    Monday-Friday 8:00 AM-5:00 PM         Why Work for Us    At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth.
